attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Richard Stallman was the founder of the Free Software Foundation.  He is the origin of the free software movement, which lead to, for example, Gnu/Linux.  We petition the PM to arrange a honor for him to acknowledge his huge contribution to the world, and the UK in particular.  Doing so would also further promote free software in the UK.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
